page.title: 03HOUSES IN PETROCKSTOWE
page.content: Residential property in{Petrockstowe comprises houses, cottages and bunga- lows, many of them on sites recorded by name, which they still bear, in the {original Domesday Book.} Much of the land and many of the buildings were until 1958 part of the{Clinton Estate and whilst 90% of the properties are now privately owned, many of the cottages date back over{200 years}and have been carefully maintained or restored. 45% are cob with thatch or slate roof, the cob usually renovated with local stone. Parts of at least 10 properties include structures over{400 {years}old. 55% of the homes have been built (or substantially rebuilt) since{1960. Nearly all these{modern properties}are bungalows with small gardens, built in cement blocks with concrete tile roofs continues......
